Pursuing Cyber Security in 2025

4/19/2025 / 3 minutes to read / Tags: Education

So, you’re interested in cyber security…

Where to Start?

Find what industry you’d like to work-in and start learning! There is a lot of choice but opportunities may be limited. If you aren’t sure what industry you’d like to work-in, then look at job boards and understand the requirements for getting into particular industries.

Some Resources

Below are some of the resources that I’ve used.

Educational

Understand your industry and what the requirements are proir to paying for anything.

  • Udemy I only bought courses when they were $11 USD

  • Pluralsight

  • Coursera

  • LinkedIn Learning

  • Western Governors University

If you decide to enroll to WGUthen you can find my referral here —WGU Referral.

You get subscriptions to Udemy, Pluralsight, and LinkedIn Learning as a WGU student. I’d caution that you really should be a ‘self-starter’ and very responsible to attend Western Governors University.

Do your research before joining any platform, or University! I chose to pay for courses on Udemy prior to pursuing higher education. Once I understood the material then I knew I was ready to work towards the degree and certifications. This was a necessary path for me understanding the industries that I wanted to work in required a combination of certifications and the degree.

I chose to attend WGU because it provided me with certifications and the degree. Things I required but you may not. You don’t need a degree or certifications necessarily to get into cyber.

Getting Hands On

The material in this section is great for mixing things up a bit. Once upon a time I would watch youtube videos on hacking and mess with vulnhub.
Then it turned to me taking udemy classes.
I’d take a break from Udemy, and pivot over to Hackthebox or Tryhackme.

  • TCM Security

  • Tryhackme

  • HackTheBox - Academy and my —Referral

  • Terminus

  • OverTheWire

  • Vulnhub

  • Blue Team Labs

  • Immersive Labs

  • PWNED Labs

Make Learning Fun

Learning can be fun when you find others to compete with in “Capture the Flag” (CTF) competitions. This is something I do with fellow WGU students.

  • picoCTF

  • CTFTIME

  • NCAE CYBER GAMES

  • NATIONAL CYBER LEAGUE

Cyber roles will likely require constant learning. Start now!
